parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To sail away. From apo and pleo; to set sail.
And thence, and from there; and then afterwards. From kai and ekeithen; likewise from that place.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From kata and a derivative of anti; to meet against, i.e. Arrive at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: The next day. Feminine singular participle of a comparative of epi and heimi; supervening, i.e. the ensuing day or night.
Right opposite, off (nautical sense), over against. Prolonged from anti; opposite.
Chios, an island in the Mediterranean.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To compare, arrive, land. From para and ballo; to throw alongside, i.e. to reach a place, or to liken.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Samus, an island of the Mediterranean.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Miletus, a city on the coast of the Roman province Asia. Of uncertain origin; Miletus, a city of Asia Minor.
